thread.title: Polish parliament houses vial of pope's blood
thread.title_full: Polish parliament houses vial of pope's blood | News24

author: news24.com
title: Polish parliament houses vial of pope's blood
text:
Warsaw - A vial containing pope John Paul II's blood was installed in the Polish parliament's chapel on Friday for the veneration of devout Catholic lawmakers.
"This event is of a purely religious nature. We won't use it for political ends," said Kazimierz Jaworski, the right-wing senator who spearheaded the project.
Born Karol Wojtyla, the Polish pontiff began his papacy in 1978 and served until his death in 2005.He was made a saint last year, to the joy of his large fanbase at home.
Jaworski said that senators from both the majority and the opposition chipped in to buy a receptacle for the relic they received from Cardinal Stanislaw Dziwisz, the pope's former secretary and current archbishop of Krakow.
